definition: to fail to meet each other/to conflict with each other/to be at odds with
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
surname Zuo
left/the Left (politics)/east/unorthodox/queer/wrong/differing/opposite/variant of 佐[zuo3]

sentences.english: That seems unlikely in my view.
Are you free to have a difference of opinion with others and express it without fear?
sentences.chinese: 当和别人意见相左时，你敢无所畏惧地表达出来吗？

sentences.english: The two parties also disagree on the time and quantum of raising the debt ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 两党还在提高债务最高限额的时间和额度上意见相左。

sentences.english: When your heart is an odds with yur head, follow your heart.
sentences.chinese: 情感与理智相左时，跟着情感走。

sentences.english: In disagreements, fight fairly. Please No name calling.
sentences.chinese: 意见相左时，不要怒目相向，也不要指名道姓争吵。

sentences.english: It just happens not to accord with our modern understanding of what would have happened to a woman struck accidentally by a spear.
sentences.chinese: 它和我们的关于这个女子被长矛意外刺死的理解相左。

sentences.english: Even if you disagree with someone, do you respect his opinion?
sentences.chinese: 即使你和某人意见相左，你尊重他们的观点吗？

sentences.english: In the matter of the arrangement of the furniture she never took the house-maid's opinion.
sentences.chinese: 在家具布置方面，她和女仆的观点总是相左。

sentences.english: Lady Whitton wasn't used to people disagreeing with her.
sentences.chinese: 惠顿夫人不习惯别人跟她意见相左。

sentences.english: Why can’t people with opposing opinions peacefully coexist in the same environment?
sentences.chinese: 为什么意见相左的人就不能在同一屋檐下和平共处呢？

sentences.english: So their views, which do not match Mr Thant's, also carry weight.
sentences.chinese: 的观点与吴丹敏相左，但有分量的。

sentences.english: Let's say that you've gotten into a disagreement and there's a long period of silence.
sentences.chinese: 假设你们意见相左，你们陷入长时间的沉默。

sentences.english: Mr. Siegel is siding with his student and against his friend.
sentences.chinese: 这一次塞格尔站到了他的学生一边，与朋友意见相左。

sentences.english: Her husband always differs with her.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫常常与她意见相左。

definition: to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
political views
to conflict with/to contradict/contradiction
to disagree/dissent
to persist in one's views
each sticks to his own view (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf
to conflict with (an idea or opinion etc)/to depart from (established norms or standards etc)
to act in a way that defeats one's purpose (idiom)
to not conform to/to be unsuited to/to be out of keeping with/should not/ought out
each sticks to his own opinion (idiom); chacun son gout
to express a different view/to take a different position
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to contradict oneself/self-contradictory/inconsistent
disagreement/differing interpretations
lit. unaligned teeth/fig. disagreement
